description: An illustration of a mancala board with two columns of six holes and two larger holes, one in each end (which are called stores). There are ten total stones, five blue and five pink, scattered around or next to the board: there is one pink stone in the top store, a blue stone in the first hole in the left column, a pink stone and a blue stone in the second hole of the left column, a pink stone in the third hole of the right column, and a pink and blue stone in the bottom store; there are two blue stones and a pink stone lying to the right of the mancala board.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
